pr_title: Correctly handle directories in getResourceAsStream of QuarkusClassLoader

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to close the stream as well?
timeline.author: geoand

replies.bodyText: No, given that this getResourceAsStream is meant to return a "live" stream, we return it live and expect the user/caller to close it whenever they are done using it (just like they would with regular non-directory based streams).
replies.author: jaikiran

replies.bodyText: Ah right... I didn't see which method this belonged to.
replies.author: geoand
gastaldi

replies.bodyText: Hello @gastaldi, do you mean it's broken because it isn't doing a check to see if the file is a directory, or something else?
replies.author: jaikiran

replies.bodyText: The class name is misleading if it handles files too IMHO
replies.author: gastaldi

replies.bodyText:
I think given that there's already an isDirectory() API on ClassPathResource, I think, it's the caller's responsibility to do that check before calling getData().
This getData() could of course do checks for isDirectory but if it does find that it's an directory, then it either has to error out or open a stream on the URL represented by the file and then read from that. All doable, but I don't have the complete background around these classes, so I'm not sure if it should be done here in this method. @stuartwdouglas what are you thoughts?
replies.author: jaikiran
